plugins.name: Stash Modes
plugins.description: This plugin enables you to "stash" variable modes within your Figma file. A stashed mode is essentially a copy of an existing mode. Although it is not directly accessible for pages and frames, you can later swap it back as a "real" mode. This feature proves handy when you want to experiment with different settings while preserving your original modes.
plugins.tagline: Save variable modes for later

It can not only help you save time and effort, improve work efficiency, but also make it easier for your products to enter the global market. Give it a try and let it bring more convenience and success to your work!

plugins.name: HYWD Style Unifier
plugins.description:
Unify style parameters throughout your figma layout for better design consistency. Convert your intuitively designed first layouts into propper yet highly effective design systems. Or just fix your final design with your existing styles. Find inconsistencies or unlinked elements easily. Swap themes or incorporate external components and adapt them to your local or global styles in a breeze.


Here is a quick intro video on what the plugin can do for you!


And here are video-tutorials on the 3 main use cases:


Best workflow for design system building


Best workflow for design linting


Best workflow for style matching



Get even more details on how to use the tool and a FREE trial license at our HAYWOOD Digital Tools online shop and the figma style unifier plugin product page!

plugins.name: Autolayout converter Helper
plugins.description:
Effortlessly locate frames and take control of your design exploration!!!


Navigate to complex Figma layers with ease! This plugin helps you traverse design hierarchies by stopping at frames and allowing you to decide the next move. Customize your searchâ€”pause anywhere and pick it up whenever you're ready (at that moment perform your change at layerâœ¨ ). Perfect for designers and developers who need precise, targeted frame navigation.


Key Features :

  1. Start Search from Any Node : Begin traversal from any selected layer in your Figma file, drilling down through layers and frames.
  2. Stop on Frame Detection : Pauses at each frame, allowing you to review, edit, or proceed to the next frame.
  3. Customisable Navigation : Choose from Next to continue, Skip to bypass children, or Custom Stop to pause as needed.


Use Cases :

  1. Designers and Developers : Streamline work on large, complex Figma files with multiple frames and layers.
  2. Efficient Frame Location : Locate frames quickly, without tedious manual scrolling.
  3. Auto Layout Validation : Essential for platforms or projects requiring strict auto layout adherence for accurate design and responsive outputs. This plugin helps ensure each frame aligns to the full auto layout setup, ensuring optimal structure and consistency.
  4. Flexible Layer Exploration : Customize your traversal to focus on only the layers that matter most for faster design reviews and targeted edits.


How to Use :

  1. Select your starting node in Figma, click Start, and let the plugin begin searching.
  2. When a layer is detected, choose Next to proceed, Skip to bypass children, or Custom Stop to pause where desired.


Boost productivity, stay organized, and manage complex Figma designs with this efficient layers finding plugin. Ideal for design reviews, auto layout validation, focused edits, and streamlined development workflows!
plugins.tagline: Navigate layers with ease: control traversal and reduce your manual drilling time by 40%

plugins.name: Universal Design (beta)
plugins.description:
UDML Exporter for Figma (beta)


Transform your Figma designs into AI-ready UDML (Universal Design Markup Language) documents. UDML Exporter creates structured, semantic descriptions of your designs specifically optimized for AI interpretation and code generation.


AI-First Design Documentation


UDML is built from the ground up to be understood by AI. Instead of trying to directly convert designs to code (which often produces messy, unmaintainable results), UDML provides AI agents with:


  1. Semantic Structure: Clear representation of layout hierarchies and relationships
  2. Design Context: Comprehensive documentation of components and their usage
  3. Style System: Organized design tokens and variables
  4. Asset Catalog: Structured references to exported graphics and icons
  5. Rich Metadata: Layer names, descriptions, and relationships that AI can interpret


Why AI + UDML?


Traditional Figma-to-code tools try to guess what components you meant to create. UDML takes a different approach:


  1. Let AI Do the Heavy Lifting: Instead of making assumptions, provide AI with rich context
  2. Semantic Understanding: AI can interpret layer names and relationships to generate appropriate components
  3. Design System Integration: AI can map your design tokens to existing system variables
  4. Framework Flexibility: Generate code for any framework or library
  5. Open and Extensible: No locked-in formats or proprietary solutions


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma using Auto Layout and components
  2. Export to UDML (optimized for AI consumption)
  3. Provide the UDML to an AI agent (like Claude or Cursor)
  4. Get clean, semantic code that matches your design system


Example AI Interpretation


<!-- UDML Export -->
<column name="user-profile-card" gap="16px">
<image name="avatar" src="assets/user-avatar.png"/>
<text name="user-name" typography="heading-medium">John Doe</text>
<text name="user-title" typography="body-regular">Senior Designer</text>
</column>


AI might interpret this as:


<!-- React Interpretation -->
<UserCard>
<Avatar src={user.avatar} />
<Heading level={3}>{user.name}</Heading>
<Text>{user.title}</Text>
</UserCard>


Perfect For


  1. Designers who want AI to understand their work
  2. Developers who need intelligent code generation
  3. Teams building or maintaining design systems
  4. Anyone looking for an alternative to traditional Figma-to-code tools


Getting Started


  1. Install the plugin
  2. Design with AI interpretation in mind
  3. Export to UDML
  4. Let AI generate your code


Design for AI


To get the best results:

  1. Use clear, descriptive layer names
  2. Leverage Auto Layout for clear structure
  3. Create consistent component patterns
  4. Document your design system tokens


Join the AI-First Design Movement


UDML is an open specification for AI-friendly design documentation. Help shape the future of AI-assisted design-to-code workflows.


docs.universaldesign.ai
plugins.tagline: Figma to code, your way

plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that lets you generate customizable QR codes with ease. Change colors, add gradients, insert logos, and create unique designsâ€”all while keeping it simple and user-friendly. Export your styled QR codes in high-quality PNG format and enhance your designs effortlessly!


Feature Suggestions:


Prototype QR Code Generator â€“ generate QR codes that link to Figma prototypes, making it easier to share interactive designs with clients or teams.

Design Asset QR Codes â€“ Allow users to generate QR codes that link to downloadable assets or design system documentation.

Social Media Links â€“ Add options to create QR codes linking to social media profiles or portfolios directly from the design canvas.

Customizable Frames â€“ Offer stylish frames or borders around QR codes to make them fit different design aesthetics.

Bulk QR Code Generation â€“ Allow generating multiple QR codes at once for product packaging, business cards, or event badges.
